title: 107_hr542
content:
The Act titled "Small Business Review Panel Technical Amendments Act of 1999" is cited as the short title. It includes findings and purposes. The "Small Business Review Panel Technical Amendments Act of 1999" finds that a vibrant small business sector is crucial for job creation and aims to enhance small business participation in the federal regulatory process by strengthening the Small Business Advocacy Review Panel process. SEC. 3. Ensuring full analysis of potential impacts on small entities of rules proposed by certain agencies. Section 609(b) of title 5, United States Code, is amended to require covered agencies to notify the Chief Counsel for Advocacy of the Small Business Administration before publishing an initial regulatory flexibility analysis. This includes providing information on the potential impacts on small entities and identifying affected small entity representatives for advice and recommendations. The covered agency must convene a review panel consisting of federal employees to review and collect advice on draft proposed rules from small entity representatives. The covered agency must convene a review panel to gather input from small entity representatives on draft proposed rules. The panel must report its findings to the agency head within 60 days, and the agency head must publish the panel's report in the Federal Register within 120 days. The agency may need to make adjustments to the proposed rule based on the panel's recommendations. The covered agency must convene a review panel to gather input from small entity representatives on draft proposed rules. The panel's findings must be reported to the agency head within 60 days and published in the Federal Register within 120 days. Adjustments to the proposed rule may be necessary based on the panel's recommendations. SEC. 4. DEFINITIONS.

Section 609(d) of title 5, United States Code, is amended to define 'covered agency' as the Environmental Protection Agency, Occupational Safety and Health Administration, and Internal Revenue Service, and 'small entity representative' as an individual or organization representing a small entity.

SEC. 5. EFFECTIVE DATE.

This Act will take effect after a 90-day period from its enactment.
